ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] RDFForms - parameterized POST to processors?
ygData.msgSnippet: Mark, ... Ah, you are right - killer argument :-) ... Yes, thought about that, but I thought that would introduce a compile- time coupling between processor

From: Jan Algermissen <jalgermissen@...>
Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] RDFForms - parameterized POST to processors?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=159556043; y=b43m3laS6uBv73zA9naXLKqOiCELDIQf-ENp6reQ1kc-hB0RwTvP75EW
X-Yahoo-Profile: algermissen1971

Mark,

On Nov 29, 2005, at 6:58 PM, Mark Baker wrote:

> I'm hesitant to support what you're asking for because it seems to  
> introduce avoidable complexity.  The complexity is that the  
> rdf:about value's semantics become ambiguous; for a Container, is  
> the type declaration about the unparameterized URI (which it is,  
> per RDF), or is it about the URI-with-query-param, which seems to  
> be what you want since that's where the data will get POSTed.

Ah, you are right - killer argument :-)

>
> To avoid that complexity, you could either tack on some triples if  
> what you're posting is RDF

Yes, thought about that, but I thought that would introduce a compile- 
time coupling between processor and submitter since there is no  
standard (as with indexParam) way to tell the submitter what triples  
to add.

Hmm...maybe this issue could be approached by seeing it as an  
'extended intent', where the parameterization is a specialization of  
the intend,not the processor. Just a thought though.

> (or use whatever must-ignore extensibility mechanism your POSTed  
> format has, if any).  If that's not an option, perhaps a multipart/ 
> form-data approach could be used, which I suppose could use some  
> first-class support in RDF Forms.

Do you have a use case for this in mind? Or just to cover it, too?

Thanks for the answers.

Jan
